name: Renaissance St. Louis Grand Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We specifically went to see the Cardinals for the weekend and to see the arch and etc. The hotel is 6-7 blocks from Busch in a so-so area. This city will be a beautiful city in 5 years or so.. lots of construction going on. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially for a 918 room hotel. They were at capacity that weekend and being that I used to manage hotels they did a great job. We were able to check in at 11am instead of 4pm which allowed us to start site seeing right away. The room was clean and comfy. The bathroom was clean with plenty of towels. We were on the 12th floor and it was very quiet for being at capacity. Ate buffet breakfast downstairs.. typical buffet. Easy check-in and check-out.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Some sites to see, obviously the Arch, Union Station, Basillica, Busch Stadium, Zoo and the whole park area and Budweiser. The Metro is pretty easy to use. If you want a FABULOUS meal make reservations at Sydney Street Cafe..... the best meal we have ever had. Lobster turnovers, Filet stuffed with lobster and dark chocolate brownie turtle is to die for!! I went based on comments here on tripadvisor.
reviews.title: Very average hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice friendly staff, but didn't seem up to handling simple requests. Something offensive smelled in my room and I talked to several different staff members about taking care of it or moving. Was given different stories and didn't feel like they really wanted to help. Also, gift shop continually ran out of papers early in the morning. When I asked why, I was told that they didn't know my group was so "literate." That's OK on the first day, but when it happens four days in a row, it makes you wonder if they are really trying to run a first-class hotel.
reviews.title: Renaissance fits the bill again!

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Renaissance Suites hotel which is right across the street from the Grand. My experience at the Suites hotel was wonderful so we tried the Grand this time. Our experience was just as wonderful as before. During out stay the hotel staff was polite, helpful and efficient. The ammenities more than exceeded our needs and the location is fabulous for experiencing downtown St. Louis. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel !!!

reviews.text: The hotel was wonderful, all of the staff were extremely friendly. The hotel is in a wonderful location with easy access to all the major sites. The room was wonderful and everything was very clean. The offsite parking is really close, so that wasn't an inconvienence. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Awesome!!!

reviews.text: Beautiful classic old hotel that was recently renovated. The staff is extremely friendly, opening doors for you and greeting you in the lobby. There were very few guests at the hotel, so there was never a crows at the pool or in the restaurant. They offered a complimentary, full breakfast every morning (buffet or made-to-order). Parking is right around the corner. Very convenient to Lacelede's Landing and everything else downtown. Rooms were kind of small, but very clean and comfortable. I'd absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel experience

reviews.text: This is Marriott at its best. It is clean, the staff is professional, and the location is excellent. Busch Stadium is within walking distance. The restaurant downstairs doesn't charge for small children. I recommend this hotel highly.
reviews.title: Loved the Grand

reviews.text: I stayed here for a convention. The hotel has some charm. The room was nice; the bed was comfortable. It was not spectacular, but certainly a good room. The hotel is very convenient for the convention center across the street. It is close to the Arch and downtown restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice Stay for St. Louis Downtown

reviews.text: The health club was better than most. The bar was crowded and the menu limited.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My main complaint is that there was no refrigerator in the room and no microwave. I have come to the opinion that they should be standard in every room. Also, they should have the Golf Channel on television.
reviews.title: Not so welcomed
A Costly "Free" Room
reviews.text: --Arrival--

We booked a 2-night stay at the Renaissance using some Marriot Rewards points. The room we stayed in would have cost $150+ at the time. Upon entering the room, we immediately noticed the filthy crumb and dirt covered carpet floor as well as an infamous hairy sink. We called housekeeping and a maid took care of the problem. When we returned after the maid had finished, the entire hallway reeked of cheap cleaning spray. As we opened the door to our room, a giant gust of noxious spray filled our nostrils and choked us until the odor finally dissipated. The carpet looked clean though; however after walking on the carpet in my brand-new, bright white socks the bottoms were soon blackened and sooty. Examining one of the beds, I noticed how the mattress was bent in a distinctive U shape. My back was sore the next morning from the terrible mattress as were the backs of my roommates in the other bed. My bed was either sat upon by multiple extremely obese people or trampled upon by a stampede of wild kids. It was probably a combination of the two groups.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Convenient
Wonderful stay at the Renaissance Suites
reviews.text: --Locked out--

reviews.title: We love this hotel
reviews.text: Although we had anticipated this as a problem and had tried to correct it with the incompetent desk staff upon checking-in, we were met by a checkout slip from under our door. This issue had to do with the fact that we were booked under two separate reservations because of the Marriot Rewards redemption system. The problem was supposed to be corrected once again by the front desk. However, when we returned to our room that evening after a day enjoying St.. Louis our room key did not work. After getting new keys from the unapologetic staff, we entered the room and found that it had not been cleaned at all that day. Frustrated, we examined the room further and found old peanuts, tissues, dirty socks, and other trash stuffed under the beds. Alerting the front desk of our latest problem regarding our very unclean room we were told that a made would be sent immediately. Two maids did arrive, but after over an hour since we had called. It did not matter though because by then we had already started changing rooms. (See below)
--The move--
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance Grand for two nights after our wedding. We live in St. Louis, so we weren't interested in the local sights, just in having a nice room to unwind after the wedding. We actually checked out the hotel before booking and were greatly impressed by the lobby and the restaurants in the hotel. It also has a Starbucks, which is nice in the morning. While the room was clean and in good shape, it was oddly shaped. The bathroom was enormous, and while that sounds like a good thing, it actually was strange and the size unnecessary. The bed was comfortable. We also used the pool and the whirlpool, both of which were okay. We had the romance package, so champagne and strawberries were delivered to our door. It was pleasant, but not worth the extra you pay for it. My favorite part about our stay was the breakfast. It really is delicious - anything you could wish for. You can create your own omelet, as well. Parking was supposed to be free with our package, but they ended up charging us for it. My husband had to call and get them to refund us the $40 (which they readily did). Looking back, I don't think our experience at the Grand was worth what we paid for it. In the future, we will probably stay somewhere cheap and just go to the Grand for dinner or drinks. That way we can still enjoy the fabulous lobby without having to pay for the expensive but average room.
reviews.title: Beautiful Lobby, Average Rooms

reviews.text: This is an old historic hotel. The atrium is beautiful and I loved the lobby with it's giant Christmas tree. The room was small but clean. It faced the courtyard which has the glass dome that is over the atrium. The exercise room was nice with an indoor pool and spa which I didn't use. They had free fruit which was a nice touch. This hotel does alot of convention business and I was disappointed as a silver marriott reward member to not get a late checkout but they were busy. I had dinner at the American Grill twice. Don't miss it.
reviews.title: I liked it

likes.liked: — Historical hotel, friendly staff, American Grill

reviews.text: This is essentially Marriott's "higher-end" hotel. While the room was clean, it was small and awkwardly laid out. For the price (especially considering it's St. Louis and not Manhattan) we expected a lot more.
reviews.title: Clean but small & awkward rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a late-night in-room dinner and breakfast the next morning. The food was standard Marriott fare: bland and overpriced.
reviews.title: extremely overpriced and they'll nickel and dime you to death

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: St. Louis is a boring midwestern city to begin with, and the Renaissance Grand Hotel offers little to spice things up for the traveler. Save your money.
reviews.title: Best stay ever

aka: Renaissance St. Louis Grand Hotel Saint Louis
